comment: Dr. Collins is super invested in his students and a great mentor. If you don't know what you're gonna do with your POLS major take his Careers class! Throughout the semester he invited a ton of interesting speakers who opened my eyes on the job market. His tests are super easy and the final project was an easy A as well. TAKE HIM!
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Caring--Respected

comment: Dr. Collins is one of my favorite classes ever.  I learned a lot about foreign policy, he cares a lot about his students, and he was great at communicating the class requirements.  Class participation in the lectures is important to him, so raise your hand once in a while.  Otherwise go to class and study and you'll do fine.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: Mostly graded on discussion posts. 2 posts per week along with responses. He grades pretty tough there, but exams are straight to the point and basically come directly from the notes & textbook. He was really straightforward with the grading scale and expectations. Would help if you asked. If you want an easy online class, take Collins
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: he's big on participation. 11 questions a week and have to respond to classmate nd then he posts his own discussions that you have to do. two tests and finals and the tests are hard 50 questions in 50 minutes. he posts his slides but they're outdated pretty eh teacher
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--So many papers

comment: Simply one of the best professors I've ever had in my life. The exams include exactly everything that was covered in class but, if you want to succeed, make sure you are also keeping up with the readings rather than just the Power Points. Take notes, ask questions, speak your mind, and he will always incentive you to be the best you can.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Inspirational

comment: Dr. Collins is very respectful of everyone. He approaches people with conflicting views or questions that may be considered dumb with his honest opinion and doesn't try to make himself look smarter or superior. Tests are around 20-25 multiples choice questions and then an essay. They're generally all easy. 1 group debate that was fairly easy too.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Respected

comment: He is one of my favorite professors. He is tough but very fair. He will teach you a lot and hold you to a high standard. His standard is one of his best attributes. If you take him seriously, he will teach you how to succeed in the field of International Affairs. Academic rigor and unbiased analysis will earn you an A.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Overall, a challenging teacher and course, I would take him again. He set relatively clear criteria to be met and I enjoyed the course. There are no live sessions, only heavy reading and outdated PowerPoints from 2000's.
rating_tags: Lots of homework

comment: DB, 2 responses, and a short written opinion due every week-- long as you don't mind writing a decent amount, you will easily pass. 3 total exams, all of which are straightforward. Best part about Dr. C is he does not inject his own political beliefs or knock your grade down if he disagrees--something all other KSU professors need to take note of.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Mainly reading the powerpoints and writing discussion posts about them. However he does state that if you do the required amount you'll recieve a B, he really wants his students to participate and ingage in order to recieve an A. If you pay attention to the syllubus it really isn't difficult. The majority of your grade is participation.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: The grade comes from two components - tests and discussion posts. Every week you have to post answers to that week's discussion questions and answer another. One response to a post by the professor. The more you post, the better! A couple of EC opportunities. Tests aren't too bad, especially if you use Google if you get stuck.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: The class structure was made easy by clear instructions from the start. The class wasn't too difficult as long as you used the textbook and the powerpoints. If you want to receive full credit and obtain an A, make sure to follow the grading requirements carefully. Even though it was online, he was so nice and willing to help! Such a nice guy!
rating_tags: Respected--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Collins was a great professor. We had a discussion post once a week, and all of the answers are right on his PowerPoint. The tests aren't bad either, just make sure to do the study guide!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: Hes incredible! I cannot say enough good things about him. This class is lecture heavy but so worth it. His tests arent difficult and just test your knowledge of the material. Hes very kind and understanding about anything. A group debate which is annoying but not awful honestly. Well worth it!! Def take him!!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Amazing lectures--Lecture heavy

comment: Absolutely wonderful professor. He is incredibly understanding and willing to help you in anyway that he can. Everyday is a lecture, theres no required homework, lectures can sometimes be long but he is so passionate about what hes talking about that it kind of lures you into wanting to raise your hand and get into a discussion. Great experience!
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Amazing lectures--Participation matters

comment: Dr. Collins is an amazing professor, if you get the chance, take him! Its lecture heavy but the material is very interesting. There are 2 tests and a final, a paper and a group debate which count the same as tests. You can miss up to 4 days and after that every day missed is 2 points off your final grade. Easy class if you show up and pay attention
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Collins is one of the best professors I've had, both in his department and at KSU. The class was clear, informative, and enjoyable, and I left with a much clearer perspective on American Foreign Policy. He tests heavily on lecture notes, and participation is important but well facilitated. He's also very helpful if you have questions or issues.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: Very interesting class altogether. Allows a few freebies for attendance, but you'll want to be there regardless; gives information you won't always find in slides online. Three exams, term paper, a group debate, and a participation grade (raise your hand before speaking or he will NOT recognize you). DO THE READINGS!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: One-two discussion posts a week. They're easy, but you can't do the bare minimum and make an A. Above and beyond gets you an A. Tests are easy if you know the material, or know how to use google. He's a nice guy, and i actually enjoyed the class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Respected--Participation matters

comment: Great professor. Took a graduate level online class on International Political Economy.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: One of my favorite teachers, he really enjoys what he teaches and tries to make lectures enjoyable. He tests arent hard at all if you utilize the study guide and show up to class. Strict attendance policy, so if you dont like showing up to class then this is not the class for you. Overall the class was easy if you made it easy on yourself.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tests? Not many

comment: He's okay. Participation matters and attendance REALLY matters. I came to class more than most but I late and that counted. Only 3 tests. No extra credit. Nice guy, gives boring lectures, but in-class discussion sometimes makes it more lively. Not a bad class to take
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Pointless discussion questions were mandatory. Students had to read textbook, power points and online resources provided (took forever). I did not participate in over half of discussions, did not read online resources, and did not read textbook and ended with a C. Easy to pass, but you have to spend a lot of time on material in order to get an A
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Hes a good guy. Lectures are basically off the powerpoint. Barely touched the textbook and I was fine. Two tests, a paper, a debate, and a final. If you really know the study guides he puts out you will ace the tests. Not my favorite professor at KSU but he is still pretty darn good.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: This professor is extremely disrespectful to students. Initially I was told that he would allow me to make up the final due to my medical emergency, He then posted my final test grade as a 0 the next morning. Then he proceeded to post my final course grade as an F on my transcript. Then he refused to answer any of my contact attempts.

Not too bad. Im not a huge fan of his lectures. I found that the way he formatted the team debate series was silly and didnt allow for real debate. Theres two tests and a final, plus a paper with vague guidelines and a team debate series. Overall not too bad but not my favorite either. Id take him again but only if I had to.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I took the 4 week summer online class. There are 2 exams and a final that make up 65% of your grade. The exams are not hard but you will need to study for them. The rest is participation. make sure you do all the module responses and do optional work that can raise your grade. Overall the class went by fast  and i made an A, so i am happy

Amazing teacher! He's very knowledgeable. Read the sylabbus carefully as Dr. Collins is a professional and tries to teach his students( sadly ) courtesy and respect. Grades and treats fairly. Love him!
This is the type of professor who will leave you at a B if you have an 89.5... Not a bad class, pretty easy, but I wouldn't say he is the most fair out there

One of my all-time favorite teachers. I took him for like three classes. Dr. Collins is extremely helpful, organized, intelligent, and well-spoken. He will challenge you, you must study and know the material. He definitely makes you responsible for your grade. Light reading, 3 tests, one group project, and one simple paper.

Was a great one month online class. Two exams, one final and two participation grades. There are 17 modules where you have to answer questions generally on the powerpoint slides, also he posts articles that requires a response. REALLY ENJOYED THIS CLASS. Recommend taking it online!
He should have been an English professor, I think that is where his passion lies because his grading is not on how well you know the material but how well you can write.

Best lecturer I have ever had, is extremely intelligent and passionate about poli sci.We had four tests, one paper, one debate, and he takes attendance for extra participation. He is not easy BUT if you study and attend class you have no reason not to make an A. He is the definition of the way a university professor should be.

I took this class during the Summer 4 week Session. It was pretty straight forward. The professor is extremely helpful with his study Guides. If you study the study guide and read the chapter you will do great. There is A LOT!!! of reading to do, but it is interesting chapters.

I took the 4 week online class in the summer. Definitely difficult, but that is expected. The class is straight forward. 2 exams, 1 final, and participation grade. His study guides are the key for good grades. Whether you are liberal or conservative, he welcomes all your opinions. I'd want to poke his brains a little about gov in the future.
This class was an over disappointment. The topics he covers in class are quite interesting but presents them very dryly. There are only 3 test in the class, and cover a lot of information.

Not an easy A but you can do well if you study his study guides. The test comes straight from them bu you MUST know them inside AND out, foward and backwards. Tests are open ended short answer and essay and he grades them very hard, We had 2 tests, a group project (easy A) and research paper, and attendance. Extra points for extensive participation

I'm taking his online class really enjoy it! You just post online discussion questions, and do some reading in the book and on PowerPoints. He's incredibly helpful, and after a horrible PoliSci experience, I would absolutely recommend him! This class is great. I was worried it might be too much for a summer class, but it's definitely do-able!

Collins has become a hard professor. I took him for Comparative Politics - was great and easy-to-understand, but for IPE is not. Seems not to give A's on papers from a class survey (not sure why). 3 books to read, plus book. Takes attendance
Dr. Collins is a very informative guy. If you truly want to learn the ends and outs of intl relations, then this is your class. Tests are MC with essays and require a good amount of studying.

I took American Government twice with different instructors. I got a D with the first instructor. however, with Mr.Collins I got a B. His class is really interesting and he is really a nice person. I recommend to take this class to get a good grade.

Dr. Collins is a difficult teacher because what he is teaching is hard! I have always been a horrible history student and I did well. Study the power points well and GO TO CLASS!! On tests he provides a pretty comprehensive study guide, if you at least try you will do well in this class. Nice, hot and challenging

He's a nice guy. Our tests were multiple choice with an essay. They are pretty straightforward but be prepared to study. He knows his stuff and expects you to cover a LOT of information on the test essays.

Collins is great. All you have to do is study the ppt. if you want to makes A's show up in class to get further understand of the ppt notes. But I have had all 4 of his classes (POLS 2240, 2250, 3350, 4438) and I haven't ever been disappointed.

Very good teacher. His powerpoints are very thorough. If you enjoy this subject, he won't put you to sleep as others say. Although there was not a lot of textbook use. Just know his very colorful powerpoints by heart and research a country you like for your research paper and you'll do well. One thing: his tests are short answer.

Very good teacher! If you enjoy Political Science you will truely enjoy this class. I didn't do so good but that was because I'm not a very good student, but I always looked forward to his class. His test are tough BUT if you go to class participate and focus you will do good. There was one Research Paper about 8 pages...not hard. Great Teacher!

Dr. Collins is extremely smart, knows his stuff, and his available and WANTS to help his students out. That being said...you must know EVERY little detail from EVERY powerpoint. I've had him 3 times, and the classes got progressively harder and his grading progressively harsher. PAY ATTENTION and make sure you have exceptional and you can pass...

After you enroll for his class and buy the textbook you won't use, go to Costco and get a three month supply of No-Doze. Then, put on your tin foil cap to try and decipher his grading which seems to be done from outer space. His "jokes" provide many cricket chirping moments that will bring you little reprieve as you fall steadily into a coma.
Interesting guy.  I learned quite a bit. I'm enrolled to take him again for a different class.
This is a cool dude. He really knows his stuff, is respectful of everyone's opinion and gives good sudy guides before a test. My only complaint is the expensive book that was not used.

Took for a summer semester and was pretty hard. There is so much information and I wish I took it during a regular semester. Look at his powerpoints and study those more than anything.  His tests are hard. Didn't use the book barely at all.  I did for the first test and saw that it wasn't necessary.  The handbook I opened once.
American Foriegn Policy is a great class.  As long you READ THE SYLLABUS, you know whats going on.

TOUGH CLASS! Collins is quick to help. Classes tend to be slow - mucho detail. Everything's pretty much from the ppts but sometimes he throw minor details from one of the books into the test. His expectations on test high! Paper is a good bit of work as well - good professor but hard!

EXTREMELY BORING TEACHER! plz repeat that to yourself to make it sinks in. everything is off powerpoint. barely any use of the two expensive books. Attendance is mandatory and he isnt easy on the grading either. he makes even the early birds fall asleep @ 9am. 2 test/a paper/ and final+attendance.dont take unless you have a burning passion 4 pols!
A great teacher ;however, slightly boring. Its a good idea to go to his classes!

Good man.  Gotta go to class and take down every little detail.  Can be extremely mundane and cause spontaneous falling asleep.  Avoid if you do not like public speaking in any of his courses.  Overall, a solid professor.
Dr. COllins is one of the best Political science professor in the School. He gives great lectures prepares you well for his exams.
Easy, as long as you study your notes really well and pay attention. I wouldn't recommend missing a class.

such an easy class! i didn't read anything... i just took notes. i got an A on every test. therefore, i got an A in the class. he gives study guides, so all you need to do is study your notes with the study guide. it was an overall good experience.

He can be very boring and very mundane concentrating on trivial details that are actually on the tests. yet he is pleasant and tries and responds to student input. Take good notes, get a B. Take down *every single mundane detail*, read the extra stuff; get an A. He has potential to be great, so i'll recommend him. Ext credit is not enough to matter

He's a great teacher!!! Even if your not good in government he makes it easy to understand and tries to relate to topic to current events. His tests aren't hard as long as you do the study guide and read the chapters. Multiple choice tests. Best government teacher I've ever had!!
He is very knowledgable about the subject.  His test are not hard and there is an optional paper to write for extra points.
